content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Fun, 
really nice representation of this problem !

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: OP addressed concerns I had and I think this contribution is ready to publish! Good job!

You talk about the sus man being able to go "STILL", "UP", "DOWN", "LEFT", "RIGHT", but each round the input is:

eneY,eneX

Either you should change the statement to talk less about the movement of the sus man in terms of UP DOWN LEFT RIGHT and then add as a constraint that the sus man can only move "UP DOWN LEFT RIGHT" / to an adjacent tile

OR

Change the input to "STILL UP DOWN LEFT RIGHT" for each round because it doesn't serve a purpose to define those terms as they don't come up in the game input.

I've never made a solo game like this, are you able to do initialization input, single game round input, and round output? I think the problem statement could be shortened quite a bit by doing that if it would be possible. If you would like I could help you with drafting those statements?

while True:
    # ene_x: the sus man's coordinate
    ene_y, ene_x = [int(i) for i in input().split()]

This is from the Python stub, the comment should be:

# ene_y, ene_x: the sus man's coordinate

Or something like that.

The sus man will make a move in response to your move, but with a cold down.

Change "cold down" to "cool down".

I'm guessing your first language might not be English? No worries, its a good puzzle. After I solve it I plan to approve it. Its great to have so much effort put into a puzzle that can work for beginners. Definitely agree with the "easy" difficulty. Great job!
This is a nice first-step pathfinding game.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice Solo Game. There are clear messages after win and lose. Graphic style is original. Nice artwork.

nice solo puzzle for beginners (like me). I needed to shuffle randomly my list of direction in my search algorithm in one test case (funny), I liked the graphics a lot as well. I did not notice the precipices on the first run, the pictures after end game are cool :-)

Nice Solo Game
All tests work fine. There are clear messages after win and lose. Graphic style is original.

What needs to be corrected:

It's Easy difficulty more than Medium.

Floor blocks are '-' in game inputs and '.' in statement. Should be same.

In default code there are strange characters, ie. 
# ene_x: the sus manâs coordinate

Thanks very much for commenting :D
The mentioned bugs are fixed, and I have changed the difficulty to easy.
Thx very much for playing! Yeah, that test case intentionally requires RNG to solve. I am glad that you figured it out. Again, much appreciated that you like my graphic XD

Definitely Yes! Yeah, my first language is not English and I struggle to make my statement appear both rigorous and clear. Also, the codingame server acts a bit weird recently. My patches took forever to upload, so it helps a lot if you can directly address my statement : D. Thx very much for your valuable suggestions and patience!

In one validator yes (not a test case!), without the matching test case...a lot of people will be stuck on this puzzle due to that. Only one test case and many validators... and it is validated by 3 guys...this puzzle validation is just bullshit, rules about test cases and validators are not respected at all !
Need of RNG to solve? Just avoid to go back to last previous position when it appears as first position of a possible shortest path.
Is it? I have no memory about your assumption. Yes, maybe test case are too easy. Please have a MP with me in french later. cheers
